returns._0: The address of the EVC contract.
address[] memory An array of addresses of the vaults that use custom liquidation logic.

params.vault: The address of the vault to check.

returns._0: bool True if the vault is set to use custom liquidation logic, false otherwise.

params.collateral: The address of the collateral vault.
params.liability: The address of the liability vault.
params.minYieldBalance: The minimum yield balance to receive.
params.receiver: The address to receive the collateral.
params.repayAssets: The amount of assets to repay.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.enabled: True if the vault should use custom liquidation logic, false otherwise.
params.vault: The address of the vault to set.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

EVC().notice: Returns the address of the Ethereum Vault Connector (EVC) used by this contract.

getCustomLiquidationVaults().notice: Returns all vaults that use custom liquidation logic.

isCustomLiquidationVault(address).notice: Checks if a given vault is set to use custom liquidation logic.

liquidate(address,address,address,addres.notice: Liquidates the debt and executes the custom liquidation logic if the vault is set to use it.

setCustomLiquidationVault(address,bool).notice: Sets a vault to use custom liquidation logic.
